description: Loom plugin hooks with XML-structured guardrails and command-based enforcement for multi-agent workflow

hooks.prompt:
<write-guardrail>

<applicability>
This guardrail ONLY applies to files in .claude/loom/threads/ directory.
For ALL OTHER files: This hook does not apply. Proceed normally.
</applicability>

<loom-artifact-guidance applies-to=".claude/loom/threads/*">
The command hook (validate-write.js) enforces file preconditions.
If the command hook allowed this write (no error message above), you MAY PROCEED.

GUIDANCE (for quality, not blocking):
- Template skills provide proper artifact formats
- Content should align with context.md
</loom-artifact-guidance>

</write-guardrail>

<edit-guardrail>

<applicability>
This guardrail ONLY applies to files in .claude/loom/threads/ directory.
For ALL OTHER files: This hook does not apply. Proceed normally.
</applicability>

<tasks-md-edits applies-to=".claude/loom/threads/*/tasks.md">
<allowed>Update checkbox status, Progress line, Last Updated timestamp, Blocked Tasks section</allowed>
<forbidden>Modifying task descriptions after review, removing tasks, changing task IDs</forbidden>
<checkbox-syntax>[ ]=pending, [~]=in-progress, [x]=complete, [!]=blocked</checkbox-syntax>
</tasks-md-edits>

</edit-guardrail>

<delegation-guidance>

The command hook (validate-task.js) enforces delegation rules.
If the command hook allowed this delegation (no error message above), you MAY PROCEED.

REFERENCE - Available Loom agents:
- loom:planner - Creates implementation plans from context.md
- loom:code-reviewer - Reviews plans and implementations
- loom:implementer - Executes individual tasks from tasks.md
- loom:explorer - Fast codebase reconnaissance

Claude Code built-ins (Explore, Plan, general-purpose) are also available.

</delegation-guidance>

<session-end>
<reminder>If there is an active loom session, consider updating the Session Log in tasks.md before ending.</reminder>
</session-end>
